text: Hardscrabble is a historic home located near Bahama, Durham County, North Carolina. It consists of two houses, one Georgian and one Federal, covered by a common cross-gable roof in the late-19th century. The Georgian was built about 1779 and the Federal section in the 1790s. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1972. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Georgian architecture in North Carolina Category:Federal architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1779 Category:Houses in Durham County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Durham County, North Carolina
title: Hardscrabble (Bahama, North Carolina)
